preqs: There are no prerequisites however it is preferable for students to have completed PGC5101 Evidence based practice prior to enrolling into this unit.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {3454, 3460, 3462, 3465, 3467, 3468, 3470, P4001, P6002}

proh: PGC5010, PGC5003This unit cannot be taken with PGC5103 Patient data and pharmacotherapy 2 without prior approval from the Course Director as there is significant overlap in content.
description: This unit will provide a broad overview or introduction to the treatment and management of infectious diseases. The focus will be on common infections seen in community and hospital settings, principles of microbiology and infectious diseases, antimicrobial use, and antimicrobial stewardship. The broad unit objectives are for students to develop and apply infectious diseases and antimicrobial use knowledge and skills in the care of patients, especially those with infections. These may be patients in the community or hospital settings. The knowledge and skills developed will be at a general level rather than at the level required for a specialist infectious diseases pharmacist.
faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
